result.execSummary:
The defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.  Pay court costs and victim witness surcharges. ALL to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 5/19/2020.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after one year of Initial confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete:   a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program, parenting program, and an anger management program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
No alcohol or controlled substances.  No contact with Justine K.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election unti his civil rights have been restored.

Hearing 7/2/2014.
**7/2/2014  $1,307.79 to Justine L.  To be paid by 7/2/2022.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Court orders DOC to take up to 25% of defendant's prison funds.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties stipulate to pay restitution in the amount of $1307.79 to Justine L. Restitution is to be paid by 7/2/2022; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Court orders DOC to take up to 25% of defendants prison funds.

Defendant Keanu M Ferguson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Keanu M Ferguson in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Felicia F.
  
As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 129 days.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 6 months consecutive. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after one year of initial confinement.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/19/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/19/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
-No contact with Justine K

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Victim Impact Statement  

Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 15 on 07/02/2014 at 08:30am.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
There was no victim notification. Case adjourned for SENTENCING on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN. Court advised the defendant that as a convicted fleon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 4/25/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Br 15 has accepted this case.  No action taken in br 34.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript (14 pages) commencing 01-16-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Thomas Livesey-Cudahy Police Department Sergeant.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF3097 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
